settings.name: name
settings.label: Input-ID *
settings.tooltip: Unique ID for this source

settings.name: host
settings.label: Address *
settings.tooltip: Address to bind on. Defaults to 0.0.0.0 (all addresses).

settings.name: port
settings.label: Port *
settings.tooltip: Port to listen on.

advanced.name: permit_origin
advanced.label: Permit Origin
advanced.tooltip: List of allowed origin IP networks. IP addresses must be in CIDR notation.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Input-ID
settings.tooltip: Unique ID for this source

settings.name: queue_url
settings.label: Queue URL *
settings.tooltip: URL of the SQS queue to poll for messages.

settings.name: delete_message
settings.label: Delete messages
settings.tooltip: Delete the message once it is processed. (default: true)

settings.name: region
settings.label: Region
settings.tooltip: AWS region of the target service.

authentication.name: auth
authentication.tooltip: Configure authentication for interacting with AWS SQS.

dropdownOptions.label: Access Key
dropdownOptions.tooltip: Configure AWS access secret for authenticating with SQS

fieldsToShow.name: auth_region
fieldsToShow.label: Region
fieldsToShow.tooltip: AWS region to send Security Token Service (STS) requests to. if empty, Defaults to region configured for the service itself

dropdownOptions.label: Assume Role
dropdownOptions.tooltip: Configure ARN of an IAM role to assume. Helpful in cross account access

fieldsToShow.name: assume_role
fieldsToShow.label: Assume Role
fieldsToShow.tooltip: ARN of an IAM role to assume.

advanced.name: endpoint
advanced.label: Endpoint
advanced.tooltip: Custom endpoint for use with AWS-compatible services.

settings.name: name
settings.label: Input-ID *
settings.tooltip: Unique ID for this source

settings.name: bootstrap_servers
settings.label: Brokers *
settings.tooltip: Comma-separated list of Kafka brokers (bootstrap servers) to use in format hostname:port, e.g., brokerip:9093

settings.name: topics
settings.label: Topics *
settings.placeholder: Comma-separated list of topic names, can degrade throughput if multiple topics are used
settings.tooltip: Kafka topic names to read events from, Regular expression syntax is supported, e.g., "topic-1","^(prefix1|prefix2)-.+"

settings.name: group_id
settings.label: Consumer Group *
settings.tooltip: Consumer group name to be used to consume events from Kafka

authentication.name: sasl
authentication.tooltip: Configure SASL authentication when interacting with Kafka.

fields.name: mechanism
fields.label: SASL Mechanism
fields.tooltip: Select an SASL mechanism to use.

fields.name: Log Schema
fields.label: log.schema
fields.tooltip: Select the log schema for this source, DPM will process data accordingly

fields.name: Log Format
fields.label: log.format
fields.tooltip: Select the log format for this source, DPM will process data accordingly

settings.name: name
settings.label: Output-ID *
settings.tooltip: Unique ID for this destination

settings.name: inputs
settings.label: Inputs
settings.tooltip: List of inputs for this destination

settings.name: bucket
settings.label: S3 Bucket Name *
settings.tooltip: Name of destination S3 bucket, E.g. my-bucket

settings.name: key_prefix
settings.label: Key Prefix
settings.tooltip: Prefix to be added to the keys of objects while uploading data to an S3 bucket, act like directory path for organizing your objects in a bucket. If using a prefix for this purpose, it must end in / to act as a directory path. A trailing / is not automatically added E.g. "year=%Y/month=%m/day=%d"

settings.name: region
settings.label: Region
settings.tooltip: Region where the S3 bucket is located.

authentication.name: auth
authentication.tooltip: Configure authentication for interacting with AWS S3 service.

dropdownOptions.label: Access Key
dropdownOptions.tooltip: Configure AWS access secret for authenticating with S3

fieldsToShow.name: region
fieldsToShow.label: Region
fieldsToShow.tooltip: AWS region to send Security Token Service (STS) requests to.

dropdownOptions.label: Assume Role
dropdownOptions.tooltip: Configure ARN of an IAM role to assume. Helpful in cross account access

fieldsToShow.name: assume_role
fieldsToShow.label: Assume Role *
fieldsToShow.tooltip: ARN of an IAM role to assume.

advanced.name: endpoint
advanced.label: Endpoint
advanced.tooltip: Custom endpoint for use with AWS-compatible services. If empty, defaults to AWS Region-specific endpoint.

advanced.name: acl
advanced.label: Object ACL
advanced.tooltip: ACL to apply to the created objects

advanced.name: storage_class
advanced.label: Storage Class
advanced.tooltip: Storage class to select for uploaded objects. Defaults to STANDARD, if it's empty
